question: The figure shows variation of R, Xₗ and Xᴄ with frequency 'f' in a series LCR circuit. Then for what frequency point is the circuit capacitive?
images/e5f6a1b2-c3d4-4e5f-2a3b-456789012345.png
explanation: A series LCR circuit is capacitive when Xᴄ > Xₗ.
Looking at the graph, Xᴄ (the curve decreasing with frequency) is greater than Xₗ (the straight line increasing with frequency) at lower frequencies.
Point A lies in the region where Xᴄ > Xₗ. Note: The options map Point A to choice (C).
